title: This couple wants to pay a nanny to travel the world with them - Metro
text:
Follow us This couple want to pay you to travel the world with them but there’s one catch Lisa Bowman for Metro.co.uk Saturday 7 Jan 2017 11:35 am Parents Kenzie and Derek from Five Take Flight want you to come and be their travel nanny (Picture: YouTube/Five take flight) 
Ever dreamed of upping sticks and travelling the world? Should crying babies be allowed to fly First Class? 
Let’s face it – many of us have. 
The idea of breaking free from the shackles of employment and seeing the sights of Mother Nature are all too tempting. 
But there’s often one thing getting in the way – money. 
Sure, there are some pretty cheap flights to be had and you can can backpack on a budget but it’s not as cheap as it used to be. 
So what if you could get paid to travel the world? The dream, no? 
Well that dream could be become a reality – if you like kids. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
The Tillotson family from Utah, USA are preparing to travel the world for a year, starting this July and they’re advertising for a travel nanny to come and look after their three kids – Porter, Beckett and Wren. 
They want the nanny to join them, to help take care of the little ones and their homeschooling. 
‘We’re looking for somebody who’s going to love our children as much as we do,’ explains mum Kenzie. 
That’s me out then. If this picture doesn’t fill you with fear then you should probably apply (Picture: YouTube/Five take flight) 
Although the itinerary isn’t set in stone, the trip will start in New York City, then take them to Iceland and Scandinavia. 
They then plan to do Europe – including places like Poland, Hungary, Italy, Spain, Turkey, Austria and France. 
The family are going home for two weeks in December for Christmas, and you’ll have those two weeks off – they’ll even pay for your flight home. 
After Christmas they’re heading back out on the road to Hawaii , New Zealand and Asia . 
‘Anywhere warm basically,’ Kenzie says. 
Fair enough. Fancy being roomies with these guys and getting paid for it? (Picture: Facebook/Five Take Flight) 
They’ll be paying for your travel, food and accommodation. 
They’ll also pay a monthly salary of $1,200-$1,500 (~£976-£1,220). 
‘It’s hard to define your exact hours because you will be living with us, but you’ll have time to yourself every day,’ explains Kenzie. 
‘And one or two days a week you’ll be able to go off on your own and have your own adventure.’ Kenzie, Porter and Beckett taking a stroll – and you could soon be the one pushing the pram (Picture: Facebook/Five Take Flight) 
Unfortunately, liking kids isn’t enough – they’re after someone with a background in teaching or early childhood development. 
Porter is in kindergarten and Beckett is in pre-school, so they want ‘structure, consistency and a fun learning environment for the kids’. 
They also want you to be happy pitching in with cooking, cleaning, packing bags, pushing strollers and the like.
